text: this is Matias and I was voted greenest
person on the planet but I hope you are
even greener than me right now I'm
wearing organic cotton underwear before
I actually buy shoes I smell them to
check whether there's any BOC volatile
organic carbons from the blue I actually
met the green man in Kuala Lumpur last
month because we were both giving a TEDx
talk at the same event and I was so
inspired that I had to track him down to
share his story
a native of rural Germany but 16 year
resident of Southeast Asia
Matias aka the green man has the most
environmentally friendly lifestyle of
anyone you'll ever meet whenever he buys
a flight he offsets the carbon emissions
by purchasing carbon credits online he
tries his hardest to never consume
plastic I travel around with bamboo
straws and metal chopsticks he uses
public transportation whenever possible
I haven't had a car for 18 years he
doesn't eat meat because it keeps a
lower carbon footprint these are just a
few of the thousands of little things
this man does to protect our Mother
Earth Matias got inspired to live a
green life ever since he developed a
strong connection with nature from a
young age I grew up when we had acid
rain problem in Germany our pine trees
were dying and people were looting the
Green Party politicians who are curbing
down with legislation the emissions the
pollution coming from factories from our
plants and a couple of years later we
had solved the acid rain problem so
through the power of people it became
clear to me that we can actually heal
the planet and being from Germany his
teachers challenged him to learn from
the mistakes of Nazi Germany through
visits to Nazi concentration camps
videos that we saw and challenged us to
make a healing impact on the future and
now he's essentially turned his passion
into a lifestyle and career in 2008 he
was voted the greenest person on the
planet in a Canadian online competition
he invests in eco-friendly companies
like a tree pension system and Panama
he's given talks in 42 countries
about environmental issues and he's
published this book it was made from a
hundred percent recycled paper no tree
was chopped I used ink made from
mushrooms I know as some of you guys may
be thinking that mattias is an extreme
case of someone trying to save the
planet but the truth is that you don't
need to alter your lifestyle that much
to make a difference number one don't
buy what you don't need less is more
that way you can well avoid the plastic
and the waste number two save
electricity and water we have water
shortages electricity is responsible for
loads of co2 emissions at the power
plants and thirdly go climate neutral if
we all go climate neutral then we would
solve the climate change problem with
personal responsibility are you healing
the planet are you part of the problem
the UN F Triple C has a goal climate
neutral now campaign pledge sign up to
it and make your life climate neutral
it's been a true pleasure to be able to
share with you the Green Man story and
even though yesterday was Earth Day
Matias wants you to know that you should
be living that way every single day
